TI_DOC.P: EBGU - Digitalisering af Armeniens oprindelsescertifikater — it-udvikler (AM-Jerevan)

CONTENTS.P: Assignment name: Digitising Armenia's Certificates of Origin — IT Developer
Procurement ref: TCS 72893
Business sector: Local Currency and Capital Markets
Project number: N/A
Funding source: Donors funds managed by the EBRD
Type of contract: Consultancy Services
Type of notice: Invitation for Expressions of Interest
Issue date: 19.3.2018
Closing date: Team 17.4.2018, 16:00 (Yerevan time)
Executing Agency (Client):
Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia, 11 Khanjyan Street, Yerevan 0010, Republic of Armenia
The Client Contact Person:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) study of international best practice and e-platform design;
(ii) development of technical requirements;
(iii) development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage an an individual IT Programme developer or IT company (the “Consultant”) to assist the CCI in the phase 3 with development of the software for issuance of certificate of origin (the “Assignment”). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— develop the software on certificate of origin issuance based on the Technical Requirements document developed in phase 2 of the project,
— arrange the implementation of necessary equipment (server, etc…),
— test the results of the e-system and roll out the software,
— recommend improvements to the final system using feedback from the testing.
Results:
— remain available to the maintenance expert for 2 years after the platform’s launch in case any programme-related core problem or issue arises,

— provide necessary information to the maintenance expert and office of the CCI on the usage, operation and maintenance of the e-platform in order for them to be able to effectively manage and maintain the e-platform once operational.
Status of Selection Process: Interested individual experts or firms are hereby invited to submit expressions of interest.

Assignment Start date and duration: The project is expected to start in March 2018 and has an estimated overall duration of 34 months. The current assignment needs to be completed within 4 months upon the receipt of the Technical Requirements Report developed in phase 2 of the project (expected to complete in September / October 2018).
Cost Estimate for the Assignment: 50 000 EUR (exclusive of VAT).

The Consultant must determine whether any indirect taxes / VAT are chargeable on the proposed services and state the basis for such. If any indirect taxes / VAT are payable, the Client will have to pay indirect taxes / VAT element to the services directly to the Consultant unless otherwise agreed.
Funding Source: It is anticipated that the contract will be financed by the EBRD Shareholder Special Fund Selection and contracting is subject to the availability of funding.
Eligibility: There are no eligibility restrictions based on consultant's country of origin.
Consultant Profile:

Individual services are required. The Consultant shall be an expert (individual expert or an expert nominated by a firm) preferably with preferably the following qualifications, experience and personal qualities:
— background in IT, preferably with graduate degree,
— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out,
— experience in digitization of business procedures will be an asset,
— understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia,
— analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues,
— ability to work effectively in a team,
— excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.
Submission Requirements: In order to determine the capability and experience of Consultants seeking to be shortlisted, the information submitted should include the following:
1. cover letter (maximum 2 pages) summarizing how the expert believes he/she satisfies the requirements as defined above under Consultant Profile;

2. CV (not exceeding 4 pages) which should include full descriptions of responsibilities carried out, not just a job title, including information on contracting entity/client, project location / country, duration (mm/yy to mm/yy), expert months provided (if different from duration), main activities, objectives;
3. completed Consultant Declaration Form and Contact Sheet, the template for which is available from the following web-link:
http://www.ebrd.com/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/csu/contact_sheet.doc

The complete expression of interest (including CVs, Consultant Declaration and Contact Sheet) should be submitted, in English via email (pdf) to the Client’s contact person, to reach the Client not later than the closing date. 1 additional copy shall reach the Bank’s contact person by the same due date. The expression of interest shall be 1 file (pdf). The Client reserves the right to reject applications of firms submitting more than one file. Only if any limitation on the permissible file size is exceeded, the Consultant may split the expression of interest into further files.
Important Notes:
1. Following this invitation for expressions of interest, a shortlist of up to the 6 highestranked consultants and/or firms will be formally invited to attend an interview.
2. The shortlist criteria are as follows:
(a) previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out 25%;
(b) experience of digitizing the business procedures 15%;
(c) experience of developing e-government systems 15%;
(d) understanding of certificate of origin issuance specifics 5%;
(e) ability to work effectively in a team 5%;
(f) ability to prioritize and work under the pressure of deadlines 5%;
(g) language skills 5%;
(h) interview 25%.

The Client (CCI) will consult with the consultant regarding the format (e.g. skype call, meeting, conference call, etc.) and date of the interview at the time of the invitation. Please note that all and any costs incurred by the Consultant in connection with attendance to interviews will not reimbursed by the Client. The highest-ranked Consultant will be selected from a shortlist and be invited to negotiate the contract, subject to availability of funding.

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) study of international best practice and e-platform design;
(ii) development of technical requirements;
(iii) development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage an an individual IT Programme developer or IT company (the “Consultant”) to assist the CCI in the phase 3 with development of the software for issuance of certificate of origin (the “Assignment”). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— develop the software on certificate of origin issuance based on the Technical Requirements document developed in phase 2 of the project,
— arrange the implementation of necessary equipment (server, etc…),
— test the results of the e-system and roll out the software,
— recommend improvements to the final system using feedback from the testing.
Results:
— remain available to the maintenance expert for 2 years after the platform’s launch in case any programme-related core problem or issue arises,

— provide necessary information to the maintenance expert and office of the CCI on the usage, operation and maintenance of the e-platform in order for them to be able to effectively manage and maintain the e-platform once operational.

Type of contract: Consultancy Services
Type of notice: Invitation for Expressions of Interest
Issue date: 19.3.2018
Closing date: Team 17.4.2018, 16:00 (Yerevan time)
Executing Agency (Client):
Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia, 11 Khanjyan Street, Yerevan 0010, Republic of Armenia
The Client Contact Person:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) study of international best practice and e-platform design;
(ii) development of technical requirements;
(iii) development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage an an individual IT Programme developer or IT company (the “Consultant”) to assist the CCI in the phase 3 with development of the software for issuance of certificate of origin (the “Assignment”). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— develop the software on certificate of origin issuance based on the Technical Requirements document developed in phase 2 of the project,
— arrange the implementation of necessary equipment (server, etc…),
— test the results of the e-system and roll out the software,
— recommend improvements to the final system using feedback from the testing.
Results:
— remain available to the maintenance expert for 2 years after the platform’s launch in case any programme-related core problem or issue arises,

— provide necessary information to the maintenance expert and office of the CCI on the usage, operation and maintenance of the e-platform in order for them to be able to effectively manage and maintain the e-platform once operational.
Status of Selection Process: Interested individual experts or firms are hereby invited to submit expressions of interest.

Assignment Start date and duration: The project is expected to start in March 2018 and has an estimated overall duration of 34 months. The current assignment needs to be completed within 4 months upon the receipt of the Technical Requirements Report developed in phase 2 of the project (expected to complete in September / October 2018).
Cost Estimate for the Assignment: 50 000 EUR (exclusive of VAT).

The Consultant must determine whether any indirect taxes / VAT are chargeable on the proposed services and state the basis for such. If any indirect taxes / VAT are payable, the Client will have to pay indirect taxes / VAT element to the services directly to the Consultant unless otherwise agreed.
Funding Source: It is anticipated that the contract will be financed by the EBRD Shareholder Special Fund Selection and contracting is subject to the availability of funding.
Eligibility: There are no eligibility restrictions based on consultant's country of origin.
Consultant Profile:

Individual services are required. The Consultant shall be an expert (individual expert or an expert nominated by a firm) preferably with preferably the following qualifications, experience and personal qualities:
— background in IT, preferably with graduate degree,
— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out,
— experience in digitization of business procedures will be an asset,
— understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia,
— analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues,
— ability to work effectively in a team,
— excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.
Submission Requirements: In order to determine the capability and experience of Consultants seeking to be shortlisted, the information submitted should include the following:

Important Notes:

(a) previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out 25%;

TI_DOC.P: ERAB - Armēnijas izcelsmes sertifikātu digitalizācija — IT izstrādātājs (AM-Erevāna)

CONTENTS.P: Assignment name: Digitising Armenia's Certificates of Origin — IT Developer
Procurement ref: TCS 72893
Business sector: Local Currency and Capital Markets
Project number: N/A
Funding source: Donors funds managed by the EBRD
Type of contract: Consultancy Services
Type of notice: Invitation for Expressions of Interest
Issue date: 19.3.2018
Closing date: Team 17.4.2018, 16:00 (Yerevan time)
Executing Agency (Client):
Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia, 11 Khanjyan Street, Yerevan 0010, Republic of Armenia
The Client Contact Person:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) study of international best practice and e-platform design;
(ii) development of technical requirements;
(iii) development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage an an individual IT Programme developer or IT company (the “Consultant”) to assist the CCI in the phase 3 with development of the software for issuance of certificate of origin (the “Assignment”). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— develop the software on certificate of origin issuance based on the Technical Requirements document developed in phase 2 of the project,
— arrange the implementation of necessary equipment (server, etc…),
— test the results of the e-system and roll out the software,
— recommend improvements to the final system using feedback from the testing.
Results:
— remain available to the maintenance expert for 2 years after the platform’s launch in case any programme-related core problem or issue arises,

— provide necessary information to the maintenance expert and office of the CCI on the usage, operation and maintenance of the e-platform in order for them to be able to effectively manage and maintain the e-platform once operational.
Status of Selection Process: Interested individual experts or firms are hereby invited to submit expressions of interest.

Assignment Start date and duration: The project is expected to start in March 2018 and has an estimated overall duration of 34 months. The current assignment needs to be completed within 4 months upon the receipt of the Technical Requirements Report developed in phase 2 of the project (expected to complete in September / October 2018).
Cost Estimate for the Assignment: 50 000 EUR (exclusive of VAT).

The Consultant must determine whether any indirect taxes / VAT are chargeable on the proposed services and state the basis for such. If any indirect taxes / VAT are payable, the Client will have to pay indirect taxes / VAT element to the services directly to the Consultant unless otherwise agreed.
Funding Source: It is anticipated that the contract will be financed by the EBRD Shareholder Special Fund Selection and contracting is subject to the availability of funding.
Eligibility: There are no eligibility restrictions based on consultant's country of origin.
Consultant Profile:

Individual services are required. The Consultant shall be an expert (individual expert or an expert nominated by a firm) preferably with preferably the following qualifications, experience and personal qualities:
— background in IT, preferably with graduate degree,
— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out,
— experience in digitization of business procedures will be an asset,
— understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia,
— analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues,
— ability to work effectively in a team,
— excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.
Submission Requirements: In order to determine the capability and experience of Consultants seeking to be shortlisted, the information submitted should include the following:
1. cover letter (maximum 2 pages) summarizing how the expert believes he/she satisfies the requirements as defined above under Consultant Profile;

2. CV (not exceeding 4 pages) which should include full descriptions of responsibilities carried out, not just a job title, including information on contracting entity/client, project location / country, duration (mm/yy to mm/yy), expert months provided (if different from duration), main activities, objectives;
3. completed Consultant Declaration Form and Contact Sheet, the template for which is available from the following web-link:
http://www.ebrd.com/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/csu/contact_sheet.doc

The complete expression of interest (including CVs, Consultant Declaration and Contact Sheet) should be submitted, in English via email (pdf) to the Client’s contact person, to reach the Client not later than the closing date. 1 additional copy shall reach the Bank’s contact person by the same due date. The expression of interest shall be 1 file (pdf). The Client reserves the right to reject applications of firms submitting more than one file. Only if any limitation on the permissible file size is exceeded, the Consultant may split the expression of interest into further files.
Important Notes:
1. Following this invitation for expressions of interest, a shortlist of up to the 6 highestranked consultants and/or firms will be formally invited to attend an interview.
2. The shortlist criteria are as follows:
(a) previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out 25%;
(b) experience of digitizing the business procedures 15%;
(c) experience of developing e-government systems 15%;
(d) understanding of certificate of origin issuance specifics 5%;
(e) ability to work effectively in a team 5%;
(f) ability to prioritize and work under the pressure of deadlines 5%;
(g) language skills 5%;
(h) interview 25%.

The Client (CCI) will consult with the consultant regarding the format (e.g. skype call, meeting, conference call, etc.) and date of the interview at the time of the invitation. Please note that all and any costs incurred by the Consultant in connection with attendance to interviews will not reimbursed by the Client. The highest-ranked Consultant will be selected from a shortlist and be invited to negotiate the contract, subject to availability of funding.

The Client Contact Person:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia

CONTENTS.P: Project Description:

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia (the Client) has requested the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the EBRD or the Bank) to provide technical assistance for “Support to the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in digitising Certificates of Origin for exporters” (the Project). The project will be delivered in 4 phases:
(i) study of international best practice and e-platform design;
(ii) development of technical requirements;
(iii) development, testing and roll-out of eplatform;
(iv) maintenance of e-platform.
Assignment Description:

The Client now intends to engage an an individual IT Programme developer or IT company (the “Consultant”) to assist the CCI in the phase 3 with development of the software for issuance of certificate of origin (the “Assignment”). The tasks of the Consultant will include, inter alia, the following:
— develop the software on certificate of origin issuance based on the Technical Requirements document developed in phase 2 of the project,
— arrange the implementation of necessary equipment (server, etc…),
— test the results of the e-system and roll out the software,
— recommend improvements to the final system using feedback from the testing.
Results:
— remain available to the maintenance expert for 2 years after the platform’s launch in case any programme-related core problem or issue arises,

— provide necessary information to the maintenance expert and office of the CCI on the usage, operation and maintenance of the e-platform in order for them to be able to effectively manage and maintain the e-platform once operational.
Status of Selection Process: Interested individual experts or firms are hereby invited to submit expressions of interest.

Assignment Start date and duration: The project is expected to start in March 2018 and has an estimated overall duration of 34 months. The current assignment needs to be completed within 4 months upon the receipt of the Technical Requirements Report developed in phase 2 of the project (expected to complete in September / October 2018).
Cost Estimate for the Assignment: 50 000 EUR (exclusive of VAT).

The Consultant must determine whether any indirect taxes / VAT are chargeable on the proposed services and state the basis for such. If any indirect taxes / VAT are payable, the Client will have to pay indirect taxes / VAT element to the services directly to the Consultant unless otherwise agreed.
Funding Source: It is anticipated that the contract will be financed by the EBRD Shareholder Special Fund Selection and contracting is subject to the availability of funding.
Eligibility: There are no eligibility restrictions based on consultant's country of origin.
Consultant Profile:

Individual services are required. The Consultant shall be an expert (individual expert or an expert nominated by a firm) preferably with preferably the following qualifications, experience and personal qualities:
— background in IT, preferably with graduate degree,
— preferably 5 years of previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out,
— experience in digitization of business procedures will be an asset,
— understanding of the process of economic reform in Armenia,
— analytical skills, with the ability to interpret and report on complex issues,
— ability to work effectively in a team,
— excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.
Submission Requirements: In order to determine the capability and experience of Consultants seeking to be shortlisted, the information submitted should include the following:
1. cover letter (maximum 2 pages) summarizing how the expert believes he/she satisfies the requirements as defined above under Consultant Profile;

2. CV (not exceeding 4 pages) which should include full descriptions of responsibilities carried out, not just a job title, including information on contracting entity/client, project location / country, duration (mm/yy to mm/yy), expert months provided (if different from duration), main activities, objectives;
3. completed Consultant Declaration Form and Contact Sheet, the template for which is available from the following web-link:
http://www.ebrd.com/pages/workingwithus/procurement/notices/csu/contact_sheet.doc

The complete expression of interest (including CVs, Consultant Declaration and Contact Sheet) should be submitted, in English via email (pdf) to the Client’s contact person, to reach the Client not later than the closing date. 1 additional copy shall reach the Bank’s contact person by the same due date. The expression of interest shall be 1 file (pdf). The Client reserves the right to reject applications of firms submitting more than one file. Only if any limitation on the permissible file size is exceeded, the Consultant may split the expression of interest into further files.
Important Notes:
1. Following this invitation for expressions of interest, a shortlist of up to the 6 highestranked consultants and/or firms will be formally invited to attend an interview.
2. The shortlist criteria are as follows:
(a) previous professional experience in developing software to develop the program, test it and roll it out 25%;
(b) experience of digitizing the business procedures 15%;
(c) experience of developing e-government systems 15%;
(d) understanding of certificate of origin issuance specifics 5%;
(e) ability to work effectively in a team 5%;
(f) ability to prioritize and work under the pressure of deadlines 5%;
(g) language skills 5%;
(h) interview 25%.

The Client (CCI) will consult with the consultant regarding the format (e.g. skype call, meeting, conference call, etc.) and date of the interview at the time of the invitation. Please note that all and any costs incurred by the Consultant in connection with attendance to interviews will not reimbursed by the Client. The highest-ranked Consultant will be selected from a shortlist and be invited to negotiate the contract, subject to availability of funding.
